title: Ishani Apsara to officiate at King of the Ring in Sweden
byline: Sri Lanka’s internationally acclaimed boxing referee Ishani Apsara has been selected once again to officiate at the King of the Ring Boxing Tournament, one of Europe’s most prestigious amateur boxing events, scheduled to take place from October 31 to November 2 in Borås, Sweden.

title: Canadian nabbed at BIA with Rs. 182.5 million worth of hashish
byline: A 21-year-old Canadian national has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) while attempting to smuggle a consignment of hashish valued at Rs. 182.5 million.

title: Tourist arrivals grow 21.8% in 26 days of October, attracting 137,876 tourists
byline: Sri Lanka’s tourism sector demonstrated continued year-on-year growth in October, welcoming 137,876 tourists in the first 26 days of the month.

title: Sri Lanka signs US $ 39mn debt restructuring deal with Australia
byline: Sri Lanka and Australia yesterday entered into bilateral agreements on external debt restructuring, marking a “significant milestone” in the island nation’s ongoing efforts to restore debt sustainability and revamp its economy, the Finance Ministry said yesterday.

title: No egg donation at Castle Street Hospital for Women
byline: Responding to recent media reports, Dr. Ajith Dantanarayana, Director of the Castle Street Hospital for Women in Colombo, clarified that there is no ova (egg) donation programme currently in progress at the hospital.

title: Sri Lanka vehicle market to face unprecedented price hike if Govt. taxes industry further
byline: The prices of all vehicle models in Sri Lanka could increase beyond affordable limits following the government’s proposal to impose a 15 per cent tax on vehicles, Vehicle Importers Association of Sri Lanka (VIASL) Chairman Prasad Manage warned.

title: Sri Lanka, Interpol team up to tackle Chinese scam network
byline: Sri Lanka has teamed with the International Criminal Police Organisation (Interpol) to curb scamming activities involving Chinese nationals who arrive here mostly on tourist visas and deport them back for legal action in terms of the Chinese law, a Minister said yesterday.

title: Major General Ruwan Wanigasooriya retires as Chief of National Intelligence
byline: Major General Ruwan Wanigasooriya, Chief of National Intelligence (CNI), relinquished his duties at the Ministry of Defence yesterday upon reaching the age of 60 years.

title: SLNA rejects minister’s statement on Muslim nursing attire
byline: The Sri Lanka Nurses’ Association (SLNA) has strongly opposed a statement made by Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism, Vijitha Herath, allowing nurses to change their uniforms according to Muslim attire as they wish.

title: Michael Kors donates $2.7M to support Sri Lanka’s school meals programme
byline: The United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) has welcomed a US $2.7 million contribution from global fashion brand Michael Kors to strengthen Sri Lanka’s National School Meals Programme.

title: Court rejects anticipatory bail of Isolace Biotech Pharma owner
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama today rejected an anticipatory bail application filed by Sugath Janaka Fernando, the owner of Isolace Biotech Pharma, who is facing serious allegations of importing substandard antibody vaccines into the country.

title: Two new deputy governors appointed to Central Bank
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (BCSL) has announced the appointment of two new Deputy Governors, confirmed by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake in his capacity as Minister of Finance.

title: Coconut prices surge as intermediaries profit from auction sales
byline: The Coconut Cultivation Board has revealed that intermediaries are earning profits of around Rs. 40-50 by selling coconuts purchased at Rs. 134 for Rs. 180 at the coconut auction.

title: Strict new rules for alcohol tax payments
byline: A new gazette notification has been issued amending the rules applicable to the payment period and levy of taxes on alcoholic products.

title: Jamaica braces for world’s strongest storm of 2025 as death toll rises to 7
byline: Jamaica is bracing for the world’s strongest storm of 2025 after Hurricane Melissa was blamed for seven deaths across the Caribbean.

title: Sri Lanka advances efforts to ratify ILO convention on workplace violence
byline: Sri Lanka is intensifying its efforts to protect workers’ rights and ensure safer workplaces by moving toward ratifying the International Labour Organization (ILO) Convention No. 190 (C190), the landmark treaty addressing workplace violence and harassment.

title: Probe launched into police officers video recording Weligama shooting suspect’s arrest
byline: The Special Investigation Unit has launched an investigatigation into the police officers who were involved in video recording the suspect who was arrested over the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabah Chairman’s shooting, Police Spoeksman F.U. Wootler said.

title: Sri Lankan arrested at BIA with Rs. 25 million worth of Kush
byline: A 29-year-old Sri Lankan national from Grandpass, Colombo, was arrested today at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for attempting to smuggle over 2.5 kilograms of Kush cannabis into the country.

title: 12 feared dead in Kenya light aircraft crash
byline: A small plane travelling from Kenya’s coast has crashed, according to the country’s aviation authority, with the 12 people on board feared dead.

title: GovPay launches online traffic fine payment in Northern Province
byline: The Northern Province officially launched on-site traffic fine payments through Gov Pay at the Kilinochchi District Secretariat under the patronage of the Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijepala today.

title: Government to recruit 8,547 to state sector
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers granted approval to the resolution furnished by the Prime Minister to grant approval to the relevant Departments and institutions

title: Cabinet approves mandatory seat belts on expressways
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the proposal presented by the Acting Minister of Transport, Highways, and Urban Development to submit to Parliament for approval the directives prepared under the Motor Vehicle Act, making it compulsory for all passengers traveling in vehicles on expressways to wear seat belts.

title: Cabinet approves four new high courts in Colombo 7
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the establishment of four new high court premises in Colombo 7 with immediate effect. This move aims to support the Ministry of Justice and National Integration in executing its activities under the Anti-Corruption National Action Plan (2025–2029).

title: Sri Lanka introduces QR code mapping for rubber farms to meet EU rules
byline: Sri Lanka has launched a nationwide initiative to map all small-scale rubber plantations using geographic coordinates in order to comply with new European Union regulations on deforestation-free imports.

title: Gunman wanted for three murders arrested in Anuradhapura
byline: Three suspects, including a gunman wanted for three murders in the Southern Province were arrested with heroin worth Rs. 2.5 million in Anuradhapura.

title: British tourist’s death in Ella caused by sudden heart attack
byline: The post-mortem has revealed that the death of the British national who was celebrating his daughter’s 34th birthday while hiking at Ella Rock has been due to a sudden heart attack.

title: SJB will decide soon on participating in joint opposition campaign: MP
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) will discuss the proposed joint opposition campaign and will make a final decision of being a part of it after studying the situation, MP Kavinda Jayawardene said today.

title: Mandhana Extends Lead in ICC Women’s Rankings
byline: The ICC Women’s Player Rankings saw major movement following a busy week at the ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025.

title: Man admits murdering Japan’s former prime minister Shinzo Abe
byline: A man on trial accused of shooting dead Japan’s former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has admitted to his murder.

title: Viral airport video of SLBFE official and woman from 2023: Chairman
byline: A viral video circulating on social media showing a conversation between a Sri Lankan woman and an official of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) at the Bandaranaike International Airport is from 2023, SLBFE Chairman Kosala Wickramasinghe clarified.

title: Belavia Airlines launches direct flights between Belarus and Sri Lanka
byline: Belavia – Belarusian Airlines, the national carrier of the Republic of Belarus, launched direct flights between Minsk and Mattala today, marking a significant step in strengthening air connectivity between Belarus and Sri Lanka.

title: Over 230,000 students in Colombo district addicted to drugs
byline: The Southern Province has recorded the highest number of student drug addicts and underworld activities in the country, while over 230,000 school students in the Colombo District have also fallen victim to drug addiction, Prisons Commissioner Jagath Weerasinghe revealed.

title: GSMB to get new investigations and raids unit: Minister
byline: Industries and Entrepreneurship Development Minister Sunil Handunnetti has called for the urgent establishment of an Investigations and Raids Unit within the Geological Survey and Mines Bureau (GSMB) to strengthen oversight and accountability.

title: New State Intelligence Chief assumes duties
byline: Major General Nalinda Niyangoda has officially assumed duties as the new Chief of State Intelligence Service.

title: Police probe video recording of Weligama shooting suspect’s arrest
byline: The Special Investigation Unit has launched an investigatigation into the police officers who were involved in video recording the suspect who was arrested over the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabah Chairman’s shooting, Police Spoeksman F.U. Wootler said.

title: Sri Lankans Return After Promising Show
byline: The Sri Lankan athletics team, which ended runners up to India at the South Asian Senior Athletics Championship returned with a tally of 40 medals that included 16 gold medals.

title: Cyclone Montha will bring gushing winds: Met. Department
byline: Cyclone Montha is likely to bring in some gushing winds which would go up to 60kmph over the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, Southern, Northern, North-Central and North Western provinces during the coming days though the impact of it has reduced.

title: Love turns to fraud: Couple guilty of fake marriage ad scam
byline: A married couple who had defrauded a man of nearly Rs. 300,000 by publishing a false newspaper advertisement claiming that they were seeking a groom for their daughter, pleaded guilty before the Colombo Chief Magistrate today.
